ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Early morning brought them enduring punishment:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And early in the morning the decreed punishment came upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Indeed an abiding chastisement came upon them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We struck their faces, blinded them and said, "Suffer Our torment of which you were warned".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed, the everlasting punishment overcame them early in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And certainly a lasting chastisement overtook them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: In the morning early there came upon them a settled chastisement:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and early in the morning the punishment decreed overtook them --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly there met them early in the morning a torment settled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Early at dawn there visited them an abiding punishment:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And at daybreak a determined punishment came upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Early morning brought upon them enduring punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:38] And verily there greeted them in the early morning, the morning time of an unspecified day, an abiding chastisement, a permanent [chastisement], continuous with the chastisement of the Hereafter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning) and this punishment is connected with the punishment of the Hereafter.
